str2: And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Strengthened from the base of trope; to twist, i.e. Turn quite around or reverse.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From en and blepo; to look on, i.e. to observe fixedly, or to discern clearly.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
And, even, also, namely.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To remind, remember, call to mind. From hupo and mimnesko; to remind quietly, i.e. Suggest to the memory.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Formerly, before. Adverb from pro; prior, sooner.
A cock, rooster. From aleko; a cock or male fowl.
From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.
Today, now. Neuter of a presumed compound of the article ho and hemera; on the day; generally, now.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From apo and arneomai; to deny utterly, i.e. Disown, abstain.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Three times. Adverb from treis; three times.
